attributes.action: Scrap the proposed Congestion Charge fee increase.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On 12 February 2008, following public and stakeholder consultation, the Mayor of London confirmed the Variation and Transitional Provisions Order 2007.
Owners of cars emitting more than 226g/km of carbon dioxide will have to pay the £25 charge – up from the current £8 per day. 
The removal of the 90 per cent Residents' Discount from the Congestion Charge for residents would be unfair.
Cars currently being driven in the congestion charging zone 17 per cent would be liable for the £25 charge and just 2 per cent for the total discount
